703823f-a.title: Brooklyn: Cortelyou Road - Brooklyn Avenue
703823f-a.text:
Cortelyou Road (Canarsie Lane), east of Brooklyn Ave., showing at the
left the Holy Cross Cemetery.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703823f-a.folder: Cortelyou Road & Brooklyn Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703824f-a.title: Brooklyn: Cortelyou Road - Canarsie Avenue
703824f-a.text:
Cortelyou Road, (Canarsie Lane), at the N.E. corner of Canarsie Ave. (01d Clove Road), showing Guard house of the Holy Cross Cemetery. This cemetery, named Galilee, was also referred to as the "Cemetery of the Catholic's". Bishop John H. Hughes aoquired in June 1849, 17 acres of land from James Duffey. This land was once a section ot the Van Brunt farm. In 1857, another 19 acres were purchased from the heirs of Adrian Vanderveer. In 1869, another 22 acres were purchased from Lefferts Cornell. The first body interred, July 14, 1849, was that of Thomas Moran, the first victim
of the cholera in Flatbush.
May 12, 1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
